abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio urges United States Congress to not approve Pres Obama's Trans-Pacific Partnership; says it would cause lower wages, more powerful companies and more expensive drugs.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio of New York raised the possibilities of lower wages and costlier medicines if the trade agreement with nearly a dozen Asian nations is approved by Congress.

headline.main: De Blasio Calls Trans-Pacific Partnership a ‘Huge Mistake’
headline.print_headline: De Blasio Urges Vote Against Obama’s Trade Deal

snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio of New York raised the possibilities of lower wages and costlier medicines if the trade agreement with nearly a dozen Asian nations is approved by Congress.
